intro: Porpax scaposa, commonly known as the slender porpax, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and have a finely toothed margin. Porpax scaposa is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
